member.name: T:Daybreak.Common.Assets.AssetReplacer
member.summary: Facilitates the dynamic and necessarily transient replacement of values.
member.remarks:
If you are intending to permanently modify an asset for the length of your mod's existence rather than in a specific or defined context, either replace the instance directly or use the Resource Pack API (TODO).
The provided APIs directly mutate the contents of an rather than, say, the stored instances in . As a result, these replacements unambiguously propagate throughout all contexts in which the asset may be needed, but they made be superseded by direct changes to values in by other mods.

member.name: T:Daybreak.Common.Features.Hooks.SubscribesToAttribute`1
member.summary:
Automatically subscribes the decorated method to the hook of type if applicable. This variant is intended for specially-generated hooks wrapping tModLoader hooks.
If this decorates an instance method, the hook will be subscribed when is called on the instance. This means instance hooks can only automatically be subscribed if the parent class is an and the instance has actually been loaded.
If this decorates a static method, the hook will be subscribed so long as the parent type is visible under and the type does not have any generic parameters (technical limitation).
member.typeparam: The hook type to subscribe the method to.
member.remarks: If the type is annotated with , whether the type is autoload-able is also taken into account. This means it takes into account the Sided-ness of the containing type and whether autoloading is enabled for it.

member.name: T:Daybreak.Common.Features.Hooks.OnLoadAttribute
member.summary:
Automatically calls the decorated function on load.
If the method is instanced, it expects to be part of a parent type implementing (in which case it is called directly after ).
If the method is static, it will just be called at the end of .
member.remarks: If the type is annotated with , whether the type is autoload-able is also taken into account. This means it takes into account the Sided-ness of the containing type and whether autoloading is enabled for it.

member.name: T:Daybreak.Common.Features.Hooks.OnUnloadAttribute
member.summary:
Automatically calls the decorated function on unload.
If the method is instanced, it expects to be part of a parent type implementing .
All methods will be run in reverse order at the start of
(before ).
member.remarks: If the type is annotated with , whether the type is autoload-able is also taken into account. This means it takes into account the Sided-ness of the containing type and whether autoloading is enabled for it.

member.name: T:Daybreak.Common.Features.Models.IStatic`1
member.summary:
A special kind of data model in which a singleton instance is created on load and creates a single real, non-null instance whose nullability contracts must be fulfilled.
This model guarantees the provided data to be fully loaded and non-null.
Only one may exist for any .
member.remarks: This is best used in situations where a loadable type definitely depends on acquired resources or data which are initialized at load time, thereby not automatically guaranting values are not nullable.

member.name: T:Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetPool
member.summary: Provides a resource pool that enables reusing instances of render targets.
member.remarks:
Renting and returning buffers with a can increase performance in situations where targets are created and destroyed frequently, resulting in excessive use of VRAM.
This class is not thread-safe, and all methods and their implementations are expected to be invoked solely on the Main Thread unless explicitly specified otherwise.

member.name: P:Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetPool.Shared
member.summary: Retrieves a shared instance.
member.remarks:
The shared pool provides a default implementation of that's intended for general applicability. It assumes targets should not be manually cleared and always returns a target of the exact request descriptor and dimensions.
Disposed on unload.

member.name: M:Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetPool.Rent(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice,System.Int32,System.Int32,Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetDescriptor)
member.summary: Retrieves a buffer that is of the exact specified dimensions and with the given render target .
member.returns: A leased target which should be disposed upon use, automatically returning the target to the pool.
member.remarks: This buffer is loaned to the caller and should be returned to the same pool via, so that it may be reused in subsequent usage of . It is not a fatal error to not return a rented buffer, but failure to do so may lead to decreased application performance, as the pool may need to create a new buffer to replace the one lost. The default implementation returns a leased target that will automatically return the pool on disposal, but different implementations or configurations are not required to do so.

member.name: M:Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetPool.Return(Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetLease)
member.summary: Returns to the pool a render target that was previously obtained via on the same .
member.param: The lease previously obtained from to return to the pool.
member.remarks:
This is automatically called by and generally should not be called manually without being explicitly told to do so.
Once a buffer has been returned to the pool, the caller gives up all ownership of the buffer and must not use it. The reference returned from a given call to must only be returned via once. The default may hold onto the returned buffer in order to rent it again, or it my release the returned buffer if it's determined that the pool already has enough buffers stored.

member.name: M:Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetPool.Dispose
member.summary:
Disposes of the pool and releases any owned render targets, including ones still potentially leased.
Generally, disposal should only be performed when either the consumer has ownership over the pool and knows when all buffers have been returned, or at the very end of execution and disposal must occur (such as during mod unloading).

member.name: M:Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetPool.ReturnNextFrame(Daybreak.Common.Rendering.RenderTargetLease)
member.summary: Queues a lease to be disposed of on the next render frame for cases where ownership of the lease is given up for rendering during a frame.
member.param: The lease to dispose of at the start of the next frame.
member.remarks: This API should generally be avoided when possible. It's a last-resort option for when you cannot guarantee ownership over a target.

member.summary:
A "snapshot" of the current state of a .

This API exists for making preservation of a 's state trivial.
